errors.title: Target Class Does Not Exist in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot find the controller class being referenced in your routes, usually due to namespace issues or missing imports.
causes: Controller namespace not imported in routes file
Using old Laravel 7 routing syntax in Laravel 8+

solutions.title: Import the controller in your routes file
solutions.code:
use App\Http\Controllers\PostController;

Route::get('/posts', [PostController::class, 'index']);

solutions.title: Use full namespace in route definition
solutions.code: Route::get('/posts', [App\Http\Controllers\PostController::class, 'index']);

solutions.title: Refresh autoload cache
solutions.code: composer dump-autoload

errors.meta_title: Fix Target Class Does Not Exist Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Learn how to fix the 'Target class does not exist' error in Laravel. Common causes include missing namespace imports and outdated autoload cache.

errors.title: 419 Page Expired Error in Laravel - CSRF Token Fix
errors.description: The 419 Page Expired error occurs when Laravel's CSRF token is missing, expired, or invalid during form submission.
causes: Session expired while form was open
CSRF token not included in AJAX request headers

solutions.title: Add @csrf directive to your form
solutions.code:
<form method="POST" action="/submit">
    @csrf
    <!-- form fields -->
</form>

solutions.title: Add CSRF token to AJAX requests
Add meta tag for CSRF token
solutions.code: <meta name="csrf-token" content="{{ csrf_token() }}">

solutions.title: Exclude route from CSRF verification (use cautiously)

errors.meta_title: Fix 419 Page Expired Error in Laravel - CSRF Token Solution
errors.meta_description: Solve the Laravel 419 Page Expired error. Learn why CSRF tokens fail and how to fix missing tokens in forms and AJAX requests.

errors.title: CSRF Token Mismatch Error in Laravel - Complete Fix
errors.description: The CSRF token mismatch error occurs when the token submitted with a request doesn't match the one stored in the session.
causes: Token expired due to session timeout
Multiple browser tabs with different tokens
Token not sent with AJAX request

solutions.title: Ensure CSRF token is in all forms
solutions.code:
<form method="POST">
    @csrf
    <!-- or -->
    <input type="hidden" name="_token" value="{{ csrf_token() }}">
</form>

solutions.title: Configure Axios to send CSRF token
solutions.code: axios.defaults.headers.common['X-CSRF-TOKEN'] = document.querySelector('meta[name="csrf-token"]').getAttribute('content');

solutions.title: Check session configuration
solutions.code:
// config/session.php
'lifetime' => 120,
'expire_on_close' => false,
'same_site' => 'lax',

errors.meta_title: Fix CSRF Token Mismatch in Laravel - Complete Guide
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel CSRF token mismatch errors. Learn about session configuration, AJAX token handling, and proper form setup.

errors.error_message: SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found
errors.title: SQLSTATE 42S02 Table Not Found in Laravel - Fix
errors.description: This database error occurs when Laravel tries to query a table that doesn't exist in the database.
causes: Table name misspelled in model or query

solutions.title: Run pending migrations
solutions.code: php artisan migrate

solutions.title: Check if table exists and migrate fresh
solutions.code: php artisan migrate:fresh

solutions.title: Specify correct table name in model
Verify database connection
solutions.code:
php artisan tinker
>>> DB::connection()->getDatabaseName()

errors.meta_title: Fix SQLSTATE 42S02 Table Not Found Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Solve the Laravel SQLSTATE[42S02] table not found error. Learn to check migrations, table names, and database configuration.

errors.title: Laravel Database Connection Refused Error - Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot establish a connection to the database server.

solutions.title: Check if database service is running
solutions.code:
# For MySQL
sudo systemctl status mysql

# For PostgreSQL
sudo systemctl status postgresql

solutions.title: Verify .env database configuration
solutions.code:
DB_CONNECTION=mysql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=3306
DB_DATABASE=your_database
DB_USERNAME=your_username
DB_PASSWORD=your_password

solutions.title: Clear configuration cache
solutions.code:
php artisan config:clear
php artisan cache:clear

solutions.title: For Docker, use container name as host
solutions.code:
DB_HOST=mysql
# or
DB_HOST=host.docker.internal

errors.meta_title: Fix Laravel Database Connection Refused Error
errors.meta_description: Resolve SQLSTATE[HY000] [2002] Connection refused in Laravel. Check database server status, configuration, and network settings.

errors.title: Laravel Access Denied for Database User - Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when the database credentials in your Laravel configuration are incorrect or the user lacks proper permissions.
causes: Special characters in password not escaped

solutions.title: Verify credentials in .env file
solutions.code:
DB_USERNAME=your_username
DB_PASSWORD=your_password

solutions.title: Clear config cache after changing .env
solutions.code: php artisan config:clear

solutions.title: Quote password with special characters
solutions.code: DB_PASSWORD="your@complex#password"

solutions.title: Grant user privileges in MySQL
solutions.code:
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON database_name.* TO 'username'@'localhost';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

errors.meta_title: Fix Laravel Access Denied for Database User Error
errors.meta_description: Solve SQLSTATE[HY000] [1045] Access denied error in Laravel. Check database credentials, user privileges, and configuration cache.

errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel's APP_KEY is not set in your .env file, which is required for encryption services.
causes: Fresh Laravel installation without key generation

solutions.title: Generate application key

solutions.code:
cp .env.example .env
php artisan key:generate

Missing use statement at top of file

use App\Models\Post;

solutions.title: Ensure namespace matches directory

errors.meta_title: Fix Class Not Found Exception in Laravel

errors.title: 405 Method Not Allowed in Laravel - Route Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when you try to access a route with an HTTP method that the route doesn't support.
causes: Route defined as GET but accessed via POST
AJAX request using wrong HTTP verb

solutions.title: Match form method to route definition
Use method spoofing for PUT/PATCH/DELETE
solutions.code:
<form method="POST" action="/posts/1">
    @csrf
    @method('PUT')
    <!-- or -->
    <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="PUT">
</form>

solutions.title: Check your routes
solutions.code: php artisan route:list

errors.meta_title: Fix 405 Method Not Allowed Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Solve the Laravel 405 Method Not Allowed error. Learn about route methods, form submissions, and method spoofing.

errors.title: Route Not Found 404 Error in Laravel - Fix
errors.description: The 404 error occurs when Laravel cannot find a matching route for the requested URL.
causes: Route not defined in routes file
Typo in URL or route path

solutions.title: Check if route exists
solutions.code: php artisan route:list | grep 'your-route'

solutions.title: Clear route cache
solutions.code: php artisan route:clear

solutions.title: Define the missing route
solutions.code:
// routes/web.php
Route::get('/your-path', [YourController::class, 'method']);

solutions.title: Check route parameter constraints
solutions.code:
Route::get('/posts/{post}', [PostController::class, 'show'])
    ->where('post', '[0-9]+');

errors.meta_title: Fix Route Not Found 404 Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel 404 Route Not Found errors. Check route definitions, clear route cache, and verify URL patterns.

errors.error_message: Permission denied - Unable to write to storage
errors.title: Laravel Storage Permission Denied - Fix Permissions
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot write to the storage or bootstrap/cache directories due to insufficient file permissions.
causes: Web server user doesn't own directories
Deployment created files with wrong owner

solutions.title: Set correct permissions on storage and cache
solutions.code:
sudo chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache
sudo chown -R $USER:www-data storage bootstrap/cache

solutions.title: For production environments
solutions.code:
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data storage bootstrap/cache
sudo chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache

solutions.title: Create storage link
solutions.code: php artisan storage:link

errors.meta_title: Fix Laravel Storage Permission Denied Error
errors.meta_description: Solve Laravel storage permission errors. Set correct ownership and permissions on storage and bootstrap/cache directories.

errors.title: View Not Found Error in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot locate the Blade view file you're trying to render.

solutions.title: Check view file exists
solutions.code:
# View name: posts.index
# File should be at: resources/views/posts/index.blade.php

solutions.title: Clear view cache
solutions.code: php artisan view:clear

solutions.title: Use correct dot notation
solutions.code:
// For resources/views/admin/posts/create.blade.php
return view('admin.posts.create');

causes: Record with given ID doesn't exist

solutions.title: Use find() instead of findOrFail() for optional records
Handle the exception gracefully
Include soft deleted records if needed
solutions.code: $post = Post::withTrashed()->findOrFail($id);

Set attributes individually if needed

causes: Inserting duplicate value in unique column

causes: Required field not provided in request

Column not set as nullable in migration

solutions.title: Provide all required values
Make column nullable in migration
Add validation for required fields
Set default value in migration
solutions.code: $table->string('status')->default('draft');

errors.error_message: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1452 Cannot add or update a child row
errors.title: Foreign Key Constraint Violation in Laravel - Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when trying to insert a foreign key value that doesn't exist in the parent table.
causes: Parent record deleted before child insertion

solutions.title: Ensure parent record exists first
Add validation for foreign key
Use cascade on delete in migration
Set null on delete for optional relationships
solutions.code:
$table->foreignId('category_id')
    ->nullable()
    ->constrained()
    ->nullOnDelete();

errors.meta_title: Fix Foreign Key Constraint Violation in Laravel

errors.title: CORS Error in Laravel - How to Fix Cross-Origin Issues
errors.description: CORS errors occur when a frontend application tries to access a Laravel API from a different origin (domain, port, or protocol).
causes: Credentials not allowed in CORS config

solutions.title: Configure CORS in config/cors.php
solutions.code:
return [
    'paths' => ['api/*', 'sanctum/csrf-cookie'],
    'allowed_methods' => ['*'],
    'allowed_origins' => ['http://localhost:3000', 'https://yourfrontend.com'],
    'allowed_origins_patterns' => [],
    'allowed_headers' => ['*'],
    'exposed_headers' => [],
    'max_age' => 0,
    'supports_credentials' => true,
];

solutions.title: For Laravel 11+ with Sanctum SPA
Frontend request with credentials

errors.title: N+1 Query Problem in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: The N+1 query problem occurs when your code executes one query to fetch records, then N additional queries to fetch related data.
causes: Accessing relationships in loops without eager loading

solutions.title: Use eager loading with with()
Enable strict mode to catch N+1
Eager load multiple relationships
Use load() for already retrieved models
solutions.code:
$posts = Post::all();
$posts->load('author', 'tags');

errors.meta_description: Solve Laravel N+1 query performance issues using eager loading with the with() method on Eloquent relationships.

Share data globally with View::share

errors.error_message: Environment variables not loading / .env values null
errors.title: Laravel .env File Not Loading - How to Fix
errors.description: This issue occurs when Laravel doesn't read values from the .env file, returning null for environment variables.
causes: Using env() in config files after caching

solutions.title: Clear all caches
solutions.code:
php artisan config:clear
php artisan cache:clear
php artisan route:clear
php artisan view:clear

solutions.title: Check .env syntax - no spaces around =
solutions.code:
# Correct
APP_NAME="My App"
DB_PASSWORD=secret123

# Wrong (has spaces)
APP_NAME = My App
DB_PASSWORD = secret123

solutions.title: Use config() instead of env() in code
Quote values with special characters
solutions.code:
APP_NAME="My App's Name"
DB_PASSWORD="pass#word!123"
MAIL_FROM_NAME="${APP_NAME}"

Show field-specific errors

causes: Loading too many Eloquent models into memory
Not using lazy collections or chunking

solutions.title: Use chunking for large datasets
Use lazy collections
Increase memory limit if needed
Stream large file downloads

errors.meta_title: Fix Memory Limit Exhausted in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Solve Laravel memory errors using lazy collections, cursor(), chunking, or by increasing memory limits appropriately.

causes: Not using queues for heavy tasks

errors.title: Redis Connection Refused in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot connect to the Redis server for caching, sessions, or queues.
causes: Wrong Redis host or port in configuration
Redis password not set or incorrect

solutions.title: Check if Redis is running
solutions.code:
# Check Redis status
redis-cli ping
# Should return: PONG

# Start Redis if not running
sudo systemctl start redis
sudo systemctl enable redis

solutions.title: Configure Redis in .env
solutions.code:
REDIS_HOST=127.0.0.1
REDIS_PASSWORD=null
REDIS_PORT=6379

# If using Redis for cache/session
CACHE_DRIVER=redis
SESSION_DRIVER=redis

solutions.title: Install predis package if phpredis not available
solutions.code:
composer require predis/predis

# Then in config/database.php set:
'client' => env('REDIS_CLIENT', 'predis'),

solutions.title: Fall back to file-based cache temporarily
solutions.code:
# In .env while debugging Redis
CACHE_DRIVER=file
SESSION_DRIVER=file
QUEUE_CONNECTION=database

errors.meta_title: Fix Redis Connection Refused in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel Redis connection errors. Check server status, configure credentials, and install required packages.

errors.error_message: Job has been attempted too many times
errors.title: Queue Job Failed in Laravel - How to Debug and Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when a queued job fails repeatedly and exceeds the maximum retry attempts.
causes: Exception thrown inside job handle() method
Database connection lost during job execution

solutions.title: Check failed jobs table
solutions.code:
# Create failed jobs table if not exists
php artisan queue:failed-table
php artisan migrate

# View failed jobs
php artisan queue:failed

# Retry a specific failed job
php artisan queue:retry <job-id>

# Retry all failed jobs
php artisan queue:retry all

solutions.title: Handle exceptions in job
Set job timeout and memory
Run queue worker with proper settings
solutions.code:
php artisan queue:work --tries=3 --timeout=120 --memory=256

# For production, use supervisor or systemd

errors.meta_title: Fix Queue Job Failed in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Debug and fix Laravel queue job failures. Handle exceptions properly, configure retries, and monitor failed jobs.

errors.title: Laravel Email Sending Failed - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel cannot send emails due to SMTP configuration issues or server problems.

solutions.title: Configure SMTP in .env
solutions.code:
MAIL_MAILER=smtp
MAIL_HOST=smtp.gmail.com
MAIL_PORT=587
MAIL_USERNAME=your@gmail.com
MAIL_PASSWORD=your-app-password
MAIL_ENCRYPTION=tls
MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=your@gmail.com
MAIL_FROM_NAME="${APP_NAME}"

solutions.title: Use Mailtrap for testing
solutions.code:
MAIL_MAILER=smtp
MAIL_HOST=sandbox.smtp.mailtrap.io
MAIL_PORT=2525
MAIL_USERNAME=your-mailtrap-username
MAIL_PASSWORD=your-mailtrap-password
MAIL_ENCRYPTION=tls

solutions.title: Use log driver for local development
solutions.code:
MAIL_MAILER=log

# Emails will be written to storage/logs/laravel.log
# Great for development without sending real emails

solutions.title: Clear config cache after changes
solutions.code:
php artisan config:clear
php artisan cache:clear

# Test mail sending
php artisan tinker
>>> Mail::raw('Test', fn($m) => $m->to('test@example.com'));

rm public/storage

del public\storage

php artisan storage:link

solutions.code:
# Open Command Prompt as Administrator
# Navigate to project directory

# Or create manually
mklink /D public\storage storage\app\public

# Rollback specific steps
php artisan migrate:rollback --step=2

solutions.title: Reset and re-run all migrations (dev only)

errors.title: Laravel Scheduler Not Running - How to Fix
errors.description: This issue occurs when Laravel's scheduled tasks don't execute, usually due to missing cron job configuration.
causes: Cron job not configured on server
Schedule not defined in Console Kernel

solutions.title: Add Laravel scheduler to crontab
solutions.code:
# Edit crontab
crontab -e

# Add this line (adjust path to your project)
* * * * * cd /var/www/your-project && php artisan schedule:run >> /dev/null 2>&1

solutions.title: Define schedule in Console Kernel
Test scheduler locally
solutions.code:
# Run scheduler once (for testing)
php artisan schedule:run

# List all scheduled tasks
php artisan schedule:list

# Run scheduler continuously (local dev)
php artisan schedule:work

solutions.title: Debug scheduled tasks

errors.title: Laravel Broadcasting Connection Failed - How to Fix

solutions.title: Configure Pusher in .env
solutions.code:
BROADCAST_DRIVER=pusher

PUSHER_APP_ID=your-app-id
PUSHER_APP_KEY=your-app-key
PUSHER_APP_SECRET=your-app-secret
PUSHER_APP_CLUSTER=mt1

# Also add for frontend

VITE_PUSHER_APP_CLUSTER="${PUSHER_APP_CLUSTER}"

Enable BroadcastServiceProvider
Configure broadcasting channels

errors.error_message: The file failed to upload / File too large
errors.title: File Upload Failed in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when file uploads fail due to size limits, permissions, or configuration issues.

solutions.title: Increase PHP limits
solutions.code:
; In php.ini
upload_max_filesize = 64M
post_max_size = 64M
max_execution_time = 300
max_input_time = 300
memory_limit = 256M

solutions.title: Increase Nginx client body size
Validate file uploads in Laravel
Check storage permissions
solutions.code:
# Ensure storage is writable
chmod -R 775 storage
chown -R www-data:www-data storage

# Create storage link
php artisan storage:link

errors.meta_title: Fix File Upload Failed in Laravel

errors.title: JSON Parse Error in Laravel API - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Laravel receives invalid JSON in a request body or returns malformed JSON responses.
causes: Invalid JSON syntax in request body
PHP errors/warnings output before JSON response

solutions.title: Ensure proper JSON request format
Disable debug in production
solutions.code:
# In .env for production
APP_DEBUG=false
APP_ENV=production

solutions.title: Return proper JSON responses
Validate incoming JSON

errors.meta_title: Fix JSON Parse Error in Laravel API
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel JSON parsing errors. Ensure proper request format, disable debug output, and return valid JSON responses.

errors.title: Undefined Relationship Error in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when accessing an Eloquent relationship that doesn't exist or is misspelled on the model.
causes: Relationship method doesn't exist on model

solutions.title: Define relationship correctly on model
Use correct case when accessing
Check inverse relationships
Debug relationship issues

errors.meta_title: Fix Undefined Relationship Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel Eloquent relationship errors. Define relationships correctly and use proper naming conventions.

errors.error_message: Session store not set on request
errors.title: Session Store Not Set on Request in Laravel - Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when trying to access session data before the session middleware has initialized.
causes: Route not using web middleware group
Accessing session in service provider boot
API route trying to use session
Custom middleware running before session starts

solutions.title: Ensure route uses web middleware
For API routes needing sessions
Don't access session in service providers
Check middleware order

errors.meta_title: Fix Session Store Not Set on Request in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel session errors. Ensure proper middleware configuration and avoid accessing sessions before initialization.

errors.error_message: 429 Too Many Requests / Rate limit exceeded
errors.title: 429 Too Many Requests in Laravel - Rate Limiting Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when a client exceeds the rate limit configured for API routes or specific endpoints.
causes: Too many requests in short time period
Bot or script making excessive requests
Forgot to configure rate limiter for high-traffic endpoints

solutions.title: Configure rate limiting in RouteServiceProvider
Create custom rate limiters
Handle rate limit in frontend
Disable rate limiting for testing

errors.meta_title: Fix 429 Too Many Requests in Laravel

errors.error_message: Command not found / artisan: command not found
errors.title: Artisan Command Not Found in Laravel - Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when trying to run an Artisan command that doesn't exist or when PHP/artisan isn't accessible.

solutions.title: Ensure you're in project root
solutions.code:
# Navigate to your Laravel project
cd /path/to/your/laravel/project

# Verify artisan exists
ls artisan

# List available commands
php artisan list

solutions.title: Register custom command
Create a custom command
Clear and cache commands
solutions.code:
# Clear cached commands
php artisan clear-compiled

# If commands still not found
composer dump-autoload
php artisan package:discover

errors.meta_title: Fix Artisan Command Not Found in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel Artisan command errors. Verify project path, register custom commands, and troubleshoot CLI issues.

errors.error_message: Class not found after composer install
errors.title: Composer Autoload Error in Laravel - How to Fix
errors.description: This error occurs when Composer's autoloader cannot find classes, usually after installing packages or moving files.
causes: Autoload files not regenerated after changes

solutions.title: Regenerate autoload files
solutions.code:
# Basic regeneration
composer dump-autoload

# Optimized for production
composer dump-autoload -o

# Clear everything and reinstall
rm -rf vendor
composer install

solutions.title: Check PSR-4 in composer.json
Add custom namespace
Clear Laravel caches
solutions.code:
php artisan clear-compiled
php artisan cache:clear
php artisan config:clear
composer dump-autoload

errors.meta_title: Fix Composer Autoload Error in Laravel
errors.meta_description: Resolve Laravel autoloading issues. Regenerate Composer autoload files, check PSR-4 configuration, and clear caches.

meta.notes: 50 high-priority Laravel errors for pSEO pages. Each error includes slug, error message, causes, multiple solutions with code examples, and SEO metadata.
